Question: Identify the grammatically correct sentence.
A: Although it was raining, but we went to market.
B: Although it was raining but went to market.
C: Although it was raining, we went to market.
D: Although it was raining, so we went to the market.
Answer: Although it was raining, we went to market.

Question: Identify the correct verb form for the sentence: “We _______ confident.”
One of the following is the study of living things:
The following sentence uses a modal verb to express permission: “__________ I leave early today?”
Choose the correct capitalization for the title of a book:
The following should be included in the legacy section of a biographical sketch:
Choose the sentence in the present perfect tense:
Choose the auxiliary verb used in the simple present tense for the third person singular form:
The following is not an imperative sentence:
I was hungry, but I waited for dinner. Choose the sentence that correctly transforms the compound sentence into a complex sentence.
A: Although I was hungry, I waited for dinner.
B: I was hungry, so I waited for dinner.
C: I waited for dinner because I was hungry.
D: I was hungry and waited for dinner.
Answer: Although I was hungry, I waited for dinner.

Question: Identify the type of conjunction used to connect two main clauses in a compound sentence.
He studied hard for the test. ________, he was confident about his performance. Choose the option that fits the blank.
Choose the correct sequence of the words in which they occur in a dictionary.
Choose the correct spelling of the word.
Identify the sentence that used the indefinite article before a name to indicate that the person is known to the speaker by name only.
A: A Miss Lily has come for you, dad.
C: He thinks he is a Napoleon.
D: I met a magician last week.
Answer: A Miss Lily has come for you, dad.

Question: _______ the main issue, everything else is fine. Choose the correct preposition that fits the blank.
Perhaps the police had to set his house on fire to force him out. Choose the synonym that means ‘force’.
He also felt a special interest in a fellow student, Mileva Maric, whom he found to be a clever creature. Choose the antonym of the word ‘clever’.
Select the correct indirect speech for: She said, “I have passed the examination”.
A: She said that she have passed the examination.
B: She said that she had passed the examination.
C: She said that I had passed the examination.
D: She said that she passed the examination.
Answer: She said that she had passed the examination.

Question: Sudha had to ________ her plans to travel due to unexpected circumstances. Choose the correct phrasal verb that fits the blank.
How long have you and Bill known ______ ? Choose the option that fits the blank.
Identify the interjection in the following sentence: “Yuck! This milk is sour.”

National parks like Ranthambore and Kaziranga protect endangered species and offer a glimpse into the country's thriving ecosystems. India's wildlife is an integral part of its natural beauty and environmental conservation efforts. The Bengal tiger is found in the dense forests of the ______.
